abstract: Baseball Roundup; autopsy results reveal accidental death of former major league pitcher Tommy Hanson was due to delayed complications of cocaine and alcohol toxicity.
lead_paragraph: Hanson, a 29-year-old former Braves pitcher, was found unresponsive at a friend’s home in Newnan, Ga., on Nov. 8.

headline.main: Cocaine and Alcohol Caused Death of Tommy Hanson

snippet: Hanson, a 29-year-old former Braves pitcher, was found unresponsive at a friend’s home in Newnan, Ga., on Nov. 8.
